title: Authors and Citation
text: Schoch D (2025). dexid: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://schochastics.github.io/dexid/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dexid: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names},   author = {David Schoch},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://schochastics.github.io/dexid/}, }

what: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names
title: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names
text: Generate memorable identifiers combining adjectives Pokémon names. Inspired codename-style ID generators, package creates unique fun labels objects, files, projects.

title: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names
text: can install development version dexid GitHub :

title: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names
text: main function dexid() generates random identifiers combining adjectives Pokémon names: package supports case styles implemented snakecase package. function dex_sentence() generates random sentence Pokémon using specific move can used identifier.
code: library(dexid) set.seed(1234)  # Generate 5 basic snake_case IDs dexid(5) #> [1] "wild_enamorus"    "similar_landorus" "tame_garganacl"   "shiny_bibarel"    #> [5] "jumbo_kleavor"  # Generate 5 Title Case IDs dexid(5, case = "title") #> [1] "Bitter Duraludon"       "Tangible Lotad"         "Misguided Azumarill"    #> [4] "Envious Gothita"        "Substantial Charmander"  # Generate 5 IDs with random digits dexid(5, add_digits = TRUE) #> [1] "ill_fated_rotom_1013" "useful_zweilous_4835" "rough_ursaluna_3911"  #> [4] "untidy_duosion_0297"  "shabby_lapras_0257"  # Generate 5 IDs restrict to specific generation(s) dexid(5, gen = 1) #> [1] "awkward_vaporeon"  "unknown_venomoth"  "educated_venomoth" #> [4] "mammoth_primeape"  "elastic_flareon" dex_sentence(5) #> [1] "Trained snivy uses metronome deliberately"    #> [2] "Rude conkeldurr uses karate chop always"      #> [3] "Bright poipole uses confuse ray solemnly"     #> [4] "Violet steelix uses kinesis loyally"          #> [5] "Itchy sinistea uses horn attack judgmentally"

what: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
title: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
text: Generate Random sentences Pokémon using moves

title: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
text: n integer. Number IDs generate. gen vector integers. generations Pokemon use. Defaults generations. case Character string. case style use. Supports styles implemented package snakecase kebab-case. ... arguments passed snakecase::to_any_case().

title: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
text: character vector length n containing generated sentences.

title: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
code: dex_sentence(3) #> [1] "Glum scraggy uses meditate acidly"          #> [2] "Ashamed dachsbun uses lovely kiss strictly" #> [3] "Growing umbreon uses splash boldly"         dex_sentence(5) #> [1] "Giddy cottonee uses karate chop mortally"    #> [2] "Impish weepinbell uses bide regularly"       #> [3] "Stormy riolu uses thunder punch really"      #> [4] "Illustrious araquanid uses bind continually" #> [5] "Normal pancham uses water gun carefully"

what: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
text: Creates unique identifiers combining random adjectives Pokemon names different formats.

title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
code: dexid(   n,   n_adj = 1,   gen = 1:9,   case = c("snake", "kebab", "small_camel", "big_camel", "screaming_snake", "parsed",     "mixed", "lower_upper", "upper_lower", "swap", "all_caps", "lower_camel",     "upper_camel", "internal_parsing", "none", "flip", "sentence", "random", "title"),   add_digits = FALSE,   ... )

title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
text: n integer. Number IDs generate. n_adj integer. Number adjectives use. Defaults 1. gen vector integers. generations Pokemon use. Defaults generations. case Character string. case style use. Supports styles implemented package snakecase kebab-case. add_digits Logical. TRUE, adds random digit end ID. Defaults FALSE. ... arguments passed snakecase::to_any_case().

title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
text: character vector length n containing generated IDs.

title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
code: # Generate 5 basic snake_case IDs dexid(5) #> [1] "complete_inkay"    "unlined_chewtle"   "advanced_snivy"    #> [4] "strong_ledyba"     "competent_linoone"  # Generate 5 IDs with 2 adjectives for more uniqueness dexid(5, n_adj = 2) #> [1] "long_mortified_wishiwashi"   "pricey_intrepid_solosis"     #> [3] "self_assured_wise_ribombee"  "bubbly_precious_basculegion" #> [5] "large_glass_ogerpon"          # Generate 5 Title Case IDs dexid(5, case = "title") #> [1] "Unsteady Buzzwole" "Chief Thievul"     "Smooth Dewott"     #> [4] "Ample Lotad"       "Blank Silvally"     # Generate 5 IDs with random digits dexid(5, add_digits = TRUE) #> [1] "naughty_tatsugiri_6984"  "practical_vigoroth_3432" #> [3] "acrobatic_umbreon_5050"  "shady_corviknight_2924"  #> [5] "infinite_gliscor_4632"    # Generate 5 IDs restrict to specific generation(s) dexid(5, gen = 1) #> [1] "unacceptable_charmander" "spry_zubat"              #> [3] "crowded_magneton"        "forceful_gengar"         #> [5] "unfinished_dratini"
